security_audit.summary: This is a content workflow automation tool that processes user-provided article links. It fetches content from specified URLs and generates AI content using Anthropic API. All operations are confined to local directories. Static findings are false positives (template literals misidentified as shell backticks, regex.exec confused with Python exec) or low-risk legitimate functionality (npm run commands, standard file operations). No evidence of malicious intent, data exfiltration, or unauthorized access.

content.user_title: Process article lists and generate viral posts
content.value_statement: Manually extracting content from multiple articles takes hours. This skill automates the entire workflow by reading your article link list, fetching full content, and generating AI-powered viral posts in your unique style.
actual_capabilities: Parse markdown files containing article links in [Title](URL) format
Automatically fetch and extract full article content using Readability
Generate viral-style posts using Anthropic AI with custom prompts
Watch input directory for new files and process automatically
Archive processed files and save outputs to designated folders
limitations: Only processes links in markdown files with standard link syntax
Requires Anthropic API key for content generation
Content quality depends on source article readability

best_practices: Use clear markdown formatting with [Title](Link) syntax for reliable parsing
Verify API keys are set in .env before running batch processing
Review generated content for accuracy before publishing
anti_patterns: Do not process files with broken or non-HTTP links
Avoid running without monitoring during first use to catch errors
Do not use for copyrighted content without proper authorization

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: Markdown (.md) and text (.txt) files with [Title](URL) link syntax.

faq.question: How does it handle rate limiting?
faq.answer: Uses pLimit with concurrency of 2 to avoid overwhelming target websites.

faq.question: Can I customize the writing style?
faq.answer: Yes, modify the prompt template in index.ts for different tones and formats.

faq.question: Where are outputs saved?
faq.answer: Generated posts go to outputs/defou-stanley-posts/ directory.

faq.question: Does it work offline?
faq.answer: No, requires internet for fetching article content and AI generation.

faq.question: What happens to processed files?
faq.answer: Input files are moved to archive/ after processing completes.
